page.title: 15Kettlethorpe Livestock Farms
page.content: Farmers keep a certain number of livestock, mainly beef cattle (Charolais crossbreed) and some sheep and pigs. They spend the summer grazing in the fields and are taken into the barns and yards for winter. Animals are eventually sold at Newark and Gainsborough markets. Crops go to local grain buyers and the sugar beet factory at Bardney. The main fears in connection with the animals are Foot and Mouth disease, Swine Vesicular disease and Bowel worm. The latter can be controlled by injection, but entry into farms is restricted, to prevent the disease spreading, as whole herds have to be destroyed should infection occur.
